step_data.thought:
Looking at the current state of the page, I can see that I'm already on the Product Views Report page. This is the 'Most Viewed Products' tab that the user wanted to navigate to. I can see the page title 'Product Views Report / Products / Reports / Magento Admin' at the top of the accessibility tree, which confirms that I've successfully reached the destination.

The page shows a report interface with filtering options like Period (Day, Month, Year), From date, To date, and Empty Rows options. There's also an Export feature to export the data to CSV or Excel XML formats.

Currently, the report shows '0 records found' with a message 'We couldn't find any records.' This means there are no product view records in the default date range, but the user has successfully reached the Most Viewed Products tab as requested.

Since I've completed the task of navigating to the Most Viewed Products tab, I should inform the user.
step_data.action: stop('You are now on the Most Viewed Products tab (Product Views Report). This page shows which products are getting the most attention from customers. Currently, there are no records displayed in the default date range, but you can adjust the filter settings to view data for different time periods if needed.')
